steps.title: Dark Academia is an internet subculture and aesthetic devoted to higher education.
steps.content: Dark Academia is an internet subculture and aesthetic devoted to higher education. Picture dimly-lit libraries, Gothic architecture, an Autumnal chill, and lots of tweed or plaid, and you've got Dark Academia. This aesthetic has been around on Tumblr since the mid-2010s, but Gen Z users catapulted it to a newfound popularity on TikTok in 2020. [1] X Research source Now, if you look up the tag “Dark Academia,” you’ll find hundreds of posts on how to nail the aesthetic—from fashion advice to home decor. As a subculture, Dark Academia values all things intellectual. There’s a heavy emphasis on reading, writing, and liberal arts studies. It’s also associated with reverence and nostalgia for old, historic institutions, like Oxford, Yale, and Harvard. [2] X Research source As an aesthetic, Dark Academia includes dark wooden furniture, rooms strewn with books, coffee shops, and vintage, preppy clothing in dark hues.

steps.title: Check out a Dark Academia novel to get into the mood.
steps.content: Check out a Dark Academia novel to get into the mood. If you’re new to Dark Academia, this is a great place to start! You’ll learn more about the genre while embracing your intellectual side. Plus, a dog-eared book doubles as the perfect accessory for a Dark Academia outfit. Here are some options to check out at the library or pick up at the bookstore. Adult Dark Academia Novels: The Secret History by Donna Tartt Babel: An Arcane History by R.F. steps.title: Watch Dark Academia movies and TV shows for some visual inspo.
steps.content: Watch Dark Academia movies and TV shows for some visual inspo. The settings and the character’s outfits can serve as the perfect decor and fashion inspiration. It’s also a great way to quickly immerse yourself in the world of Dark Academia if you don’t have access to (or time to read) a Dark Academia book. Popular Dark Academia movies include Dead Poets Society , Good Will Hunting , The Social Network , Sherlock Holmes , and the Harry Potter films. [5] X Research source Dark Academia shows include The Queen’s Gambit , A Series of Unfortunate Events , The Umbrella Academy , and Wednesday . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Dress the part with Dark Academia-inspired clothing.
steps.content: Dress the part with Dark Academia-inspired clothing. Dark Academia fashion draws heavily from vintage and preppy aesthetics. To nail this look, opt for classic, formal pieces, like plaid or tweed blazers, argyle sweaters, tailored trousers, pleated skirts, and loafers. [7] X Research source Stick to darker, Autumnal colors, like burgundy, deep green, gray, brown, and black. Cold weather staples like knit cardigans, turtlenecks, and tights are also on-theme. [8] X Research source Dark Academia is all about the vintage aesthetic, so check out your local thrift store for some authentic, stylish options that won’t break the bank!

steps.title: Set the scene with some Dark Academia decor.
steps.content: Set the scene with some Dark Academia decor. If you’re ready to go all-in on the Dark Academia aesthetic, transform your living space with moody, vintage decor, ambient lighting, and an Autumnal color palette. [9] X Research source This will help you feel like you’re studying in a Gothic tower at a centuries-old university, no matter where you live! Stick to a color palette of dark, moody hues, like forest green, burgundy, dark gray, and black. This goes for wall paint, furniture, curtains, and throws. [10] X Research source Create the perfect vibe with dim, ambient lighting. Opt for flickering candles, fairy string lights, or small lamps, rather than your typical overhead lights. Decorate your walls with framed prints of classic paintings, antique mirrors, and vintage photos. To give your space an academic feel, display your favorite books in a large bookshelf, or stack them on side tables or against the wall. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Dark Academia has evolved into genre of novels, films, and TV shows.
steps.content: Dark Academia has evolved into genre of novels, films, and TV shows. These stories typically take place at an elite university or private boarding school, complete with crumbling Gothic buildings, flickering candles, and stacks of old books. They often follow a group of tight-knit students as they explore “dark” themes, such as perfectionism, obsession, and thirst for forbidden knowledge. [12] X Research source Donna Tartt’s 1992 book, The Secret History , is often considered the quintessential Dark Academia novel. It follows a group of morally gray college students whose study of Classics leads to murderous consequences. In the years since the book’s publication, Dark Academia stories have become increasingly popular, especially within the YA (Young Adult) genre. [13] X Research source
